title: (x) Squarish techno text sans / Sans font? - Soho Gothic {Jan}
content:
Does anyone know what font it is? Cheers.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120303123011im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_5196.jpg)
author: splinter

comments.content:
I think it's very similar to [Camingo Dos](http://web.archive.org/web/20120303123011/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/jan-fromm/camingo-dos-pro/), which has an alternate g like the sample. However, the W does not match in upper or lower case. The sample shows a lower centerpoint than Camingo has for its w's.

- Mike Yanega

Right you are Jan! They don't have it at MyFonts, so I couldn't find it. [Here it is](http://web.archive.org/web/20120303123011/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/Detail.htm?pid=4339236&/cgi-bin/MsmGo.exe?grab_id=0&page_id=39707&query=SOHO%20GOTHIC&SCOPE=Fonts) at Fonts.com. I think the Medium weight was used.

- Mike Yanega
Your question [has been answered last week](http://web.archive.org/web/20120303123011/http:/typophile.com/node/66076). Yes, it is Soho Gothic.

Here's why I thought Camingo was close (it's the bottom one. Soho is on top.). It was hard to match sample sizes from two different site test drives, but you get the idea. The W,w difference, the way the y tail connects, and the i dots are the only immediately obvious differences to me (recognizing that I lack the calibrated eyeballs of some of you folks) :-)

- Mike

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120303123011im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Soho-Camingo_4590.gif)

Florian, I still can not follow your links. "Access denied"

- Mike
Mike, I hope that this problem will get solved soon. I linked to an older Type ID thread about the same sample.
